Holly Marcia McGhee and Michael Alan Steiner were married yesterday at the Friends Meeting House in Manhattan. The Rev. Sean B. Murray, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the nondenominational ceremony.

Ms. McGhee, who is 34 and is keeping her name, was until last month an executive editor and associate publisher of Michael di Capua Books in Manhattan. Later this month, she is to open Pippin Properties, a management and representation agency in Manhattan for children's book authors and artists. She graduated from Cornell University.

Her parents, Gabrielle and Donald H. McGhee, live in Holland Patent, N.Y. Her father, who is retired, was a distribution and quality-control consultant at Dairylea Cooperative Inc., the dairy in East Syracuse, N.Y. Her mother is a marriage and family therapist in private practice in Barneveld, N.Y.

Mr. Steiner, 26, is an index options trader on the American Stock Exchange for the New York office of the Susquehanna Investment Group. He graduated magna cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania, where he was elected to Phi Beta Kappa.

His parents, Lois and Andrew Steiner, live in Midland Park, N.J. The bridegroom's mother is a consumer service representative in Mahwah, N.J., for the Ridgewood Savings Bank. His father owns Steiner Plumbing and Heating in Midland Park.
